message: Learn django which is the web framework for python, I think we need to learn this this is the real web geeks, What do you think?

data.message: Emad Mokhtar Habib Does knowing python is pre-requis ?

Yes knowing python is required however you don't have to be an expert...
You guys interested in django with python check the new Python Tools for Visual Studio (PTVS), It turns Visual Studio into a real python IDE that supports django with intellisense, debugging, profiling and much more

Ahmed Adel Hossny you can jumpstart by this interactive course http://www.codecademy.com/tracks/python and Islam Eldemery dude you will use VS to code python which open source and free with something not free from Microsoft :D dude use JetBrains PyCharm http://www.jetbrains.com/pycharm/
I used pycharm over 3 months and I liked it but then converted to VS :D I don't know how long you have been using pycharm.. bs give the VS a chance and tell me what did you find better
And what is the problem with being not free.. pycharm itself isn't :D ( skype me if you want the full version :P )
PyCharm & VS are not free, but you can use Python Tools for Visual Studio with VS Integrated Shell, which is free (according to my info)

I've used Python for many years, and it's a great language. Django is one of many different web frameworks for Python, and it will help you learn more about the power of Python.  

There are a lot of web frameworks for Python, because it's easy to build your own web framework, but don't try to learn all of them because this will waste your time. I advise you to learn Django well, then you can check other frameworks

You should start with the Django tutorial (https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.5/), then work on a medium project & start picking different parts of the framework (caching, ORM, templates, etc). You can check the Django book (http://www.djangobook.com/en/2.0/index.html), but it doesn't cover the latest versions, so you'll need to go back to Django documentation to learn the newest parts

Finally, please run this command after you install Python, and make sure you understand everything that is written

c:\> python -c "import this"
